data.title: Footie trickster officially opens Chippenham ground
authors: The Wiltshire Gazette and Herald Staff
data.meta_description: Football freestyler Billy Wingrove was on hand to entertain crowds with a selection of skills and tricks at Stanley Park Sports Ground in Chippenham…
data.text:
Wingrove was at the site to officially open a new third generation (3G) artificial grass pitch, changing room facility and meeting room.

The project was made possible thanks to a £351,229 grant from the Football Foundation, the country’s largest sports charity.

Billy Wingrove is one the most internationally renowned football freestylers in the world, gaining more than 40 million hits on YouTube, and appearing in adverts alongside Lionel Messi, Christiano Ronaldo and the entire Manchester United squad.

Speaking at the event, Wingrove pointed out the importance of the grassroots game and how it helped him develop his talent: “When I was growing up grassroots football was a significant part of my life. It helped give me a love for the game and a desire to work hard at improving and developing my skills.

“Attending the event today and viewing all the youngsters enthusiasm playing on the new pitch and using the new changing rooms, it shows how many people in the local community will benefit from this project.

"The all weather surface will help ensure people are able to continue playing during the winter months as well that is important."

The new facilities will provide ongoing access to the 80 local clubs who use the facility and allow the opportunity for more people to take up the game.

Funded by the Premier League, The FA, and the Government via Sport England, the Football Foundation is the nation’s largest sports charity.

Peter Hussey, manager of Stanley Park Sports Ground at Chippenham Town Council, said: “This is a proud time for Chippenham Town Council and for me as Community Football Development Officer.

"It has been my dream for over four years to improve this facility for the benefit of the community and thanks to the support of the Football Foundation and its funding partners, as well as other funding partners and clubs, that dream has finally been realised”.

Paul Thorogood, Chief Executive of the Football Foundation, said: “We are delighted that the local community of Chippenham will have access to these fantastic new facilities and commend the club and the Wiltshire County FA for their hard work in making this happen.”
